title: The Spirit of Imagination
description: Spirit (n.) 1. The prevailing or typical quality, mood, or attitude of a person, group, or period of time. 2. A volatile liquid, especially a fuel, prepared by distillation. Imagination (n.) 1. The faculty or action of forming new ideas, or images or concepts of external objets not present to the senses. 2. The part of the mind that imagines. That is all a reader needs to know before beginning this story. Your imagination has been teased. Set it free within the pages of S. A. Tawk's The Spirit of Imagination. It deserves the freedom to roam.
author: S.A. Tawks
